author: {'steamid': '76561198000187506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1466271583}
review: I enjoyed this! It's messy, but this developer definitely put forward a lot of effort. There are minor bits of jank but the game attempts to do a lot with artistic visuals. At minimum I believe that there is plenty of atmosphere to love if you already like this kind of game. I certainly think it was worth 8 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271042523', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1637197247}
review:
Очень жалею, что купила эту игру.
Если вы вдруг тоже подумали, что это какой-то необычный недооценённый проект, редкая жемчужина, то НЕТ. Игра не расслабляет путешествием по необычным мирам, управление как будто вылезло из допотопных времён, ни логики, ни красоты нет. В ней вообще ничего нет. Просто ради прикола её глянуть может и стоит, но уж точно не за те деньги, в которые её оценили. Посмотрите сначала прохождение и передумайте это брать, вы ничего не потеряете.

Хотя зачем я вру. Любопытство, конечно, всё бы пересилило, но настоящей причиной, по которой я её бросила были эти ужасные волны по краям экрана постоянно. Разработчики почему-то решили, что добавить ощущение сотрясения головного мозга на всю игру - это весело. НЕТ, это ужасно раздражает! Даже на мир позалипать толком не дают.
:(

author: {'steamid': '76561198069935501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1503190666}
review:
The most contemplative experience i have went through, and perhaps for my whole life.
You may need to be used to basic controls of a first person game.
It's not worth it for some, But for me it was worth the price. I recommend trying out the demo first to see if it's for you.
There is a existing bug in one of the chapters that prevents progression, but there's a solution listed in the forum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030311754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1486764341}
review:
This was odd.

One of those "what the feck is going on?" kind of games.

I guess it was interesting... being a bit mad, but it felt like that was what it was... trying to be mad for mads sake.

Like a "look at me and play me, because I'm weird" game.

I tried all the chapters, and only spent a short time on it... but I had to give up in the end as I didn't feel like I was doing anything... just moving about and looking at stuff.

So sorry, its a no from me on this one.

review: No any kind of communication from the game, not even the environment tells you anything. Tbh it feels like a gibberish of assets and interactions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065666577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1587944990}
review: Wish I could've enjoyed this game, I just couldn't. The puzzle solving was obtuse. The sound design was unpleasant. The graphics had a lot of rendering issues, not to mention the swirling, overwrought textures that got nauseating after thirty minutes. I appreciate the game's goal of providing some visual poetry, but it just fell flat, despite the captivating screenshots. Can't recommend this one, unfortunately.
developer_response: And what do you think about the musics ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198343073491', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1533598042}
review:
Не осилила. Цель была расслабиться перед сном, после тяжелого трудового дня. Ожидала чего-то типа гуляния по люцидному сновидению, но было ощущение, что попала в нервозную бредовую петлю... С осознанными сновидениями ничего общего.
От жутких бесцельных мотаний начало дико укачивать и тошнить...
Все хаотично и дергано. 
Особенно добили громкие пугающие звуки с затемнением экрана при подходе к краю карты или неправильному порталу (или что это там было, как это еще назвать)
Поэтому осадок от внутриигровой атмосферы крайне неприятный.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4046, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1552803988}
review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9686972/]Follow "[b]First Person Exploration and Puzzle Games[/b]" for more games like this![/url][/quote]
I only played the first world, of 6.  The world consisted of 3 levels, each of which had something that looked like a puzzle but actually consisted of walking into a bunch of bright lights and watching a bunch of really weird cutscenes over and over.  The cutscenes had no words - in fact the game has no discernible story whatsoever.

So if you like exploring really weird areas and watching really weird cutscenes, you might enjoy it.  Otherwise, I'd say look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031670464', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1426553086}
review:
Στα [-]
•  Εκτινάξεις, ανυψώσεις, σκαρφαλώματα, βουτιές κι ισορροπίες στό κενό, σ' ένα σαχλό παιχνίδι πού απλά εκμεταλλεύεται τίς δυνατότητες πού προσφέρουν τά νέα 3D προγράμματα. 
•  Χοντροκομμένα γραφικά, αδιάφοροι γρίφοι - ή, καλύτερα, υποψίες γρίφων. 
•  Στόν ένα από τούς πέντε κόσμους υπάρχει κάποιο bug πού δέν θά σ' αφήσει νά τόν τελειώσεις (καί τό χειρότερο, ο μπιπ-κατασκευαστής του δέν θέλει νά τό παραδεχτεί, αποδίδοντάς το σέ πρόβλημα αργού μηχανήματος, πράγμα πού είναι ξεκάθαρο ότι δέν ισχύει). 
•  Μικρής διάρκειας. 

Συνοψίζοντας
•  Σά νά δίνεις γιά πρώτη φορά σ' ένα παιδάκι κάποιο πρόγραμμα ζωγραφικής. Θ' αρχίσει νά παίζει μέ όλα τά χρώματα, σχήματα κι εφφέ πού τού προσφέρει, μέ τελική κατάληξη μιά μουτζούρα. 

Παρεμφερείς Τίτλοι
NIKO: THROUGH THE DREAM
PNEUMA: BREATH OF LIFE

http://adventures-index10.blogspot.com/2013/11/cylne.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198053606051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1529859635}
review: I don't recommend it, poorly made and tedious compared to others of the same genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369359741', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1535997191}
review:
Cylne is an interesting surreal game where you are exploring dreamlike, strange environments and trying to figure out what to do and how.
The gameplay is very intuitive but you'll get the hang of it. I found the platforming parts difficult at times but I'm quite bad at it.
Once I got stuck in one of the chapters and it turned out it was a very rare bug. With the kind help of the developer I was able to get through it and complete the chapter. 
I really enjoyed the unusual gameplay and because of the helpfulness of the dev I highly recommend this experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994147692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1532393576}
review: Seems like a beginners first attempt at game development. Visually amaturish, gameplay confusing and frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013469422', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1531983976}
review: 게임 분위기는 전반적으로 불쾌하고 퍼즐의 의도도 알 수가 없고 여러모로 그닥...

author: {'steamid': '76561198104728296', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1529090673}
review:
The idea behind Cylne is beautiful but except the soundtracks, this game made me feel nauseous. After playing it for about half an hour I ended up feeling frustrated and confused. The soundtrack is okay though, I believe that's the only thing I liked about this game.

The game looks nothing like the screenshots, and it was extremely buggy on my end. Don't buy it, you'll end up refunding it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260599146', 'num_games_owned': 2714, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1526775817}
review: If you are into this kind of production, this is a good one. The artistic representation seemed on spot to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978698121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1518987878}
review:
Surreal, but also ugly. And mainly boring.
The environments could be surreal and interesting but without anything gameplay-wise or story-wise in there... well in the end they're kinda pretty put empty and pointless.
Also everything is really glitchy like someone just cobbled stuff together in the Devkit and ran with it.
Skip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074912672', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1518802544}
review: Ok c'est pas ouf

author: {'steamid': '76561198014237668', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1515365687}
review:
Puh... Kunst objektiv zu bewerten ist nicht wirklich möglich für einen Laien und daher darf ich hier meine subjektive Laienmeinung preisgeben: Das Spiel ist öde.

Warum? Nun, weil "MIND, Path to Thalamus" und "The Void" sich ebenfalls unter Kunst verkaufen lassen und deutlich besser als Kunst erkennbar sind. Dieses Spiel jedoch ist eine Aneinanderreihung von willkürlichen Objekten, Texturen und Aktion-Reaktionsmustern. Es wird etwas von dem Prometheusmythos erwähnt, später kann man etwas davon erkennen, aber es fehlt an irgendeinen Ansatz von Hinweis, worum es in diesem Spiel ungefähr gehen soll. Es gibt Puzzles, die keine Puzzles sind, weil keine logische Lösung vorhanden ist, womit sie nur durch willkürliches Probieren und Herumlaufen "lösbar" sind. Es gibt random Effekt- und Kameraeinlagen, die keine symbolische Deutung aufweisen, sondern eben nur einfache Effekte zu sein scheinen.

Aber vielleicht bin ich auch einfach nur oberflächlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439935809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1516856784}
review: 艺术品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198002572144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1506113474}
review:
It would seem that I am lacking some obscure culture, esoteric education, or psycoactive drugs that would otherwise enable me to understand this "visual poetry".

This game makes up in obscurity and obfuscation what it lacks in narative and direction.

Not as colourful as The Witness, but way more pointless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064392148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1503146452}
review:
I did not like this game. I tried all 6 chapters, but I did not find any fun in it. I so much preferred Mind path to Thalamus as a surrealist game.

The art in Cylne is interesting and beautiful, and the game might be qualified as a walking simulator, or an art project as it consists mostly of looking around a succession of surrealist 3D drawings. But in the end it felt more like experiencing a succession of dreams/nightmares, giving me nausea at some point.

Here are the two main aspects of the game I did not like:

- While walking around the 5 first chapters, the player experiences some permanent blurry vision (halo) on all sides of the screen, which worsens if you go in the wrong direction giving you the illusion of being sick, or hurt. In one of the chapters, I even got a complete black screen and did not know anymore in which direction to go back to, it was getting tedious so I just jumped to the next chapter.
I love exploring, and taking screenshots of sceneries I like, but this aspect kind of killed it. I would have so much preferred hitting invisible walls instead of diminished vision, and having less or no fog and less light glares. I understand that this is part of the game, but it felt like looking at some landscape behind curtains, or without glasses. And I do not understand why this halo had to be on all the time.
I did not see any way to disactivate this.

- Also the game consisted mostly of walking around and moving to the right spot that will start a cutscene before accessing the next scene or activating some object. I don’t mind losing control of the camera for a bit, but here, it was just too much. Sometimes, I had only made three steps, and already I was activating something... At a point, it felt more like watching a film than being part of a game, killing the immersion…


With a clearer vision, and more control of the game, this could have been a much more enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992427003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1538233311}
review: Glad I bought this on special offer and not full price!! I enjoy this type of adventure game and although it is quiet short, I didn't complete it. The game play is easy to pick up but the pace is slow and I imagine this is to pad out the game, The last few chapters involve very very exact and precise timing and mouse movements to allow the player to land on exactly the correct spot to trigger an object to procede further. This is NOT what I was expeting and could not complete leaving me very frustrated and grumpy to be honest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015144135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1498837680}
review: The screenshots for this game made it looks a lot more visually attractive than it is in reality. I was looking forward to a mysterious atmosphere and a beautiful world to explore, but the poor quality graphics ruined the immersion. The strange swirling static around your field of view was quite nauseating.. and there was quite a lot of glitching and stuttering that made it unplayable in the end. I got a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1499274740}
review:
Jeu dans le genre "prout prout", qui vous fait vite comprendre que vous êtes chez un artiste, qui a la fâcheuse tendance à vous le redire chaque seconde du jeu... c'est exaspérant.
Sans compter la prise de contrôle de la camera qui casse l’immersion.
Il n'y a qu'un seul niveau sympa c'est celui dans lequel on joue un peu (où la sphère nous fait voyager)

Préférez antichamber

author: {'steamid': '76561198028307114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1498597437}
review:
The screenshots are "nicer" than the actual game...

Most envirnments are just 3D shapes covered in stone textures and copy and pasted over and over again. Then you wander around amongst them in fog.

Boring....

I love exploration games, but this one just doesn't have anything. When you appear in the environment, what you see is what you get, no matter how far you roam within it.

Refund...

author: {'steamid': '76561198152240484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1548905985}
review:
초현실적인 게임 배경이 돋보이는 퍼즐형 어드벤처 게임 .
플레이어는 6개에 달하는 각기 다른 공간에 던져지는데
처음엔 뭘해야하는지 도통 감이 잡히지 않는다.
플레이어가 해야할 일은 각 공간마다의 
메카니즘을 이해하고 작동시켜 공간들이
상징하는 의미들을 알아가는것이다.
힌트키가 있긴하지만 그림하나 달랑 던져주는식이라
별로 도움이 되지는 않는데
그나마 다행인건 진행이 막힐정도로
난해한 구간은 없다.
신비로움을 넘어 기묘하기까지한 게임 배경은
나의 취향을 제대로 적중해
도전과제 , 트레이딩 카드 
아무것도 준비되어있지 않은 이 게임을
두고두고 플레이하고싶게 만든다.

7 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970355287', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1485025088}
review:
This is not a game.
Let me start by making that clear because the people who made it have no idea on how to make proper game desgin, infact i dont even think they care.

This is what i can only describe as the most arrogant attempt at "art"
You never do anything in the game, nothing really matters. There is no story at all and the people who made it i suspect barely know how to code.

This isn't even so bad its good, it is just bad.
And even worse, there are several times the game locks your movements because something is "happening" (som basic model with bumb mapping moves across the screen), During this you cannot do anything but sit there and wait. And the game is full of these episodes,
It's as boring as it gets, stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336856634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1483230054}
review: I couldn't get into it. I love puzzle games and I was really excited about this game and how beautiful it looked, but there is no story to it, at least not one that I could discern, and no purpose except to solve the puzzles which you don't know you're doing right or wrong till you get through it. I think it was just too abstract for me personally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078899268', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1481793533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044295712', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1464745634}
review:
Perhaps if you played games with these kind of graphics when you were younger you might like this, but as someone who started playing with games like Oblivion (which I count as basically benchmark-decent graphics), it truly was a painful experience to play.  Super strange game, as well.  I would not personally suggest it, but I can see where some people might.

The biggest upside is that it is very surreal and challenging, though sometimes to the point of being a con...like, you seriously don't have a clue what the heck is going on.

Biggest con is the graphics.  I think I probably would have stuck through with the game, but I really just cannot play the game as is.

Interesting idea.  Very unique gameplay.  Too hard to see depth or anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200975998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1476776006}
review: I bought this in large part because it looked like it would be a beautiful, atmosphereic world to explore. Unfortunately, I found the graphics disappointing, especially the textures, which seemed several years out of date in their artistic quality. (Hopefully I'm correct that it's because of the game, rather than because of my Mac's graphics.) I can't comment on the poetic premise of the game, because I didn't play it long enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208140724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1447538343}
review: Jogo muito curto, não vale a pena pegar tudo isso pra jogar 2 horas. :T

author: {'steamid': '76561198044922003', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1469684604}
review:
Interesting surreal cinematic experience. Don't play this game expecting mechanical challenge or intrigue. Most of the fun of this game comes from interpreting vague symbols and surreal phenomena. In the end it all ended up being extremely vague to me - the artist's "intended" meaning is lost here and I think that's sort of the point. While it's interesting to think about, the game really gives you very little, if anything, to grab onto in terms of a concrete understanding. I found it simpler to grasp when considering each level as a standalone art piece. But the ending suggests otherwise, which totally left me stumped.

Overall, while not perfect, I found it enjoyable and beautiful to see. The sound work is fantastic too - though some sounds (particularly one on the last level) are too loud in the mix and can be a bit too jarring. As a piece of interactive audio-visual art, it succeeds on many fronts. But when the developers use the term surreal, they are truly channeling the essense of surrealist art, i.e. Dali and Beksinski. It is truly surreal and succeeds in fantastic presentation and visual and auditory art that meshes excellently together. Don't kill yourself trying to interpret it though - like Dali has described surreal art, it's all about the stream of consciousness. Perhaps that's the best way to enjoy the bulk of this game.

Also, I could not beat the bonus chapter. I beat the rest of the game in ~2 hours though. It's length is not a bad thing, though. I think it is a strength. It's worth the full price, much like a film would be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001072955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1476044988}
review:
I like fantasy, exploring, and surreal landscapes. Therefore, I [i]adore[/i] Cylne. And, since one cannot die in this game, I was able to take my time and look around at the very beautiful and imaginative world. 

Now, after reading most of the negative reviews, I want to be clear: Make sure your computer can handle this game. Also, there is no platforming, dying, fighting, killing or linear story. Just super-cool exploring with some simple puzzles thrown in for extra fun. At 5 hours, I am about 2/3 done.  

9/10 (Wish it was longer.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031633060', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1468188381}
review: The graphic is terrible unoptimized, I can't play with everything changes light or something else when i just move the mouse. Is that beta?

author: {'steamid': '76561198062333665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1486153764}
review: Very puzzling game, I feel like I'm bumbling along and hoping that I am doing something that means I'm making  progress.  Apart from that it's a very imaginative game, very surreal, for me with no artistic imagination it certainly gives me a sense of wonder and what will be the next stunning image.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171146837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1627755355}
review:
This game or as I see it an intractive piece on art, has positives and some annoying negatives.

Chapter 1, 2, 3 are the best and most interesting, 4 is good, 5 is not for me and 6 is good, there is just no clue to do a lot of the time as I found 5 hard and 1 part in 6.

The early chapters save, the late ones unfortunately do not, as for getting most of the way through 6 and going back to it from the start.

This would be better if it were a bit more obvious, I know it is a mystery theme but still.

So, I would recommend this on the visuals and how strange it is, but for logic and other stuf I cannot.
This does have potential with a bit more narrative would be more enjoyable but on sale it's worth it for the first 4 and last chapter in my opinion. But don't expect too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999206409', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1461761133}
review: Interesting idea, but short and poorly executed.  There are far better options in the "bizarre puzzle/exploration" genre, such as Dear Esther, The Old City: Leviathan, Mind: Path to Thalamus, and Lifeless Planet.  The only justification on this one was the cheap on-sale price.  Everyone wants to create the next Myst, but this one felt like the developers weren't even trying that hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069602281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1457243189}
review: Interesting and enjoyable experience, although a bit frustrating at times.  Some of the platforming bits defeated me, but there are large sections of the game that do not present any problems on this score.  The puzzles were innovative along with the underlying concepts.  Very atmospheric, mostly beautiful, and philosophical.  I like the way that you can go back to chapters in any order.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045639343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1502611640}
review:
I just accidentally solved a puzzle on purpose by doing exactly what I thought I shouldn't do because I figured I should probably do it.

☺/10 would try to figure out what this game doesn't not un-mean again (again.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198104809258', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1459923899}
review: I am glad steam refunds are a thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216727684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1456764581}
review: It's an immersive and atypical game. Even it's abstract, you want to know what will happen after and there is a lot of ambiances : mistery, sadness, light, horror... Some textures or sounds are not perfect but I think it doesn't really matter. The open structure let access to every level and this help when we are stuck. Things become clearer with the last level. This experience requires a global vision to understand it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159277161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1455490765}
review:
I'm one chapter in, and I'm a little disappointed. Hoping it turns around.

The complete lack of narrative and logic leaves me floundering for a reason to be interested in this game. I can see the beautiful images and soundscape they've designed, and the bizarre, alien world is sort of intriguing in its way. But for me, without context I just can't maintain interest. The puzzles I've played so far haven't been particularly difficult, and they lack any sense of real logic or physics so it just feels like vaguely wandering around playing with shapes until something happens. 

I want to like it, and I usually do like surreal, experimental games like this. They've clearly put some thought into creating something artistic and beautiflul. I can see how this could be a game for somebody, just not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015481934', 'num_games_owned': 10380, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1457439621}
review:
Cylne, un gem sur steam.
Créer par une seule personne, le jeu nous emmène dans son univers que je qualifierais de WTF.
Les graphismes sont jolis malgrès quelques bugs de textures.

Pas de narration ou autres textes ce qui pour moi est un bon point, ça nous permet d'être en totale immersion avec le jeu.
Je le considère comme un simulateur de marche - puzzle.

En tout cas un univers bien à part qui enchantera les amateurs de ce style de jeu.

Pouce BLEU.
ENJOY!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198134449538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1454546217}
review: I don't like that there's  only the option to like or dislike a game, but this game would probably get 2 or 2.5 stars from me. Yes, I've only played a short amount oftime but I really don't have an interest in playing more. I'm sorry, but the menu and game itself looks like a bad school project. I'm all for surreal and exploration games but this one seems so pointless to me and is very aethetically displeasing.Yes, this is my own opinion but I just feel like there are so many better exploration games out there that I regret buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994269283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1453434909}
review: Reminds me of having one of those really weird dreams. Game isn't very good and graphics aren't very technically impressive (though the design makes up for in in parts). Not recommended at full price, but if purchased at a value, and you're looking for an abstract experience that's considerably light in substance, well, there's worse ways to spend two hours. 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085357371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1450513586}
review: Very interesting premise! Great visuals and puzzles as well. The reward of this game (for me) comes from finally solving a puzzle and being able to proceed to the next beautiful realm. However it is definitely not for those with low patience or a sole desire to mindlessly kill things. WOuld certainly recommend to fans of surreal art, great atmosphere and definite challanges.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972076777', 'num_games_owned': 1870, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1449445926}
review: I like exploration "games" or walking simulators, but this one I found rather boring and unclear. And on my PC the graphics looks nothing like the screenshots...

author: {'steamid': '76561198031975325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1447656455}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960527255', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1441183223}
review: Get this on sale. It's very interesting, but too short to warrant $12 when there are other longer games for roughly the same price. It has very interesting visuals, some nice fitting music, and a unique overall style. There isn't much to complain about except that it's sometimes abstract, but I assume that's the point. In general Cylne is enjoyable, just keep in mind it's a unique experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050384203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1443990576}
review:
[h1]Все дороги ведут в унитаз[/h1]

Игра была куплена автором рецензии из-за того что автор польстился на красивые скрины. Автор никогда так жестоко не ошибался. Ибо картинки – единственное достойное что есть в игре. Да и это весьма сомнительно. Музыка гарантированно вас выбесит лупящими по нервам звяканьями гитарных струн, сюжет не оставит впечатлений потому что его тут тупо нет, а паззловая составляющая… Найти нужную дыру и прыгнуть туда – вот и вся интеллектуальная сложность Цильна. 
Меню на фоне винегрета из облаков, звёзд и сливной воронки, подсвеченное молниями из головы безрукой статуи. И вообще, напоминает МКС, управляемую с калькулятора.
[b]В первой главе[/b] мы играем со странным гибридом унитаза и душа шарко, с целью подсветить беленьким ржавые сиськи унитаза (кстати, их у него 5 штук)
[b]Во второй главе [/b]предстают глазу родные картины советского бассейна – полукруглого и выложенного кафелем, а также мы бегаем босиком по раскалённому мангалу. И всё ради того, чтобы выяснить, что мы спалили к чертям сделанное из угля пианино с глазами (хотя, если там внутри бассейн и мангал, нафиг такое пианино нужно вообще).
[b]В третьей [/b]нас за труды праведные забрасывают на слащавый курорт, похожий то ли на ванильный пудинг, то ли на груду белых козьих шариков. Победно задрав задницу к небу, съезжаем мордой вниз по цветочной клумбе. И тут, блин, поджидает засада в виде очередной головоломки с бассейном. С лабиринтом внутри, ага. И гаснущим светильником, когда всё это погружается во тьму. Клаустрофобам не рекомендуется, короче, шараханье в чёрно-белом замкнутом пространстве точно подарит вам пару неприятных минут.
[b]А в четвёртой главе[/b], облицованной чёрным кафелем советских бань и сотнями светильников в виде чьих-то серьёзных щей,  лично меня ждала подлянка в виде багнутости. После попадания в водоворот невозможно никуда двинуться или прыгнуть и наш герой остаётся в этом сливном бачке навечно. Воистину, все дороги ведут в унитаз.
[u]Итого:[/u] «Наркомания!» орут, когда видят нечто необычное или не вписывающееся в рамки традиционного игропрома. Но увы, даже творческая наркомания может быть скучной, бессвязной и безыдейной. «Цильн» попытался показать нечто безумное и в то же время простое в освоении. Не вышло. Это вам не мрачный ядовитый абсурд American McGee’s Alice и не гениальная простота тетриса. За подобным, пожалуйста, туда.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028754990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1441270411}
review: always confusing, always beautiful, mildly difficult at times. not exactly sure what the prometheus level was about, it seemed unfinished. oh and the jump function is utterly useless, not that you need it. all in all though, the devs put a lot of effort into the design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972013798', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1436819036}
review:
Очередное приключение в невыразимых мирах под странным названием Цильн. Разработчики изо всех сил пытались забросить игрока в мир, который был бы иррациональным, сумасшедшим и красивым одновременно. Короче говоря, психоделичный. В самом начале ещё что-то маячит, но к 4-й главе становится понятно, что "не взлетит". Слабая музыкальная часть, примитивные звуковые эффекты, невразумитальные переходы от главы к главе, совершенно непонятная физика совершаемых действий - всё это делает геймплей скучным тыканием по локациям. Где-то надо запустить механизм, где-то - просто взглянуть на определённый предмет. Но в целом всегда неясно, что же всё-таки надо сделать и что же ждёт нас в конце хотя бы главы! Общую картину слегка вытягивает графика. Она неплоха, оригинальна и заставляет сделать пару-тройку скриншотов. Временами можно полюбоваться игрой света и тени. Локации сильно различаются по стилистике: то мы находимся в замкнутых "помещениях", то выходим на открытые пространства. Местами окружение напоминает всё тот же вездесущий "Myst", местами - практически уже культовый "Тургор" (иностранцы знают адаптированную версию "Void"). На этом положительные стороны и заканчиваются. 
Отдельное изобретение разработчиков - "гало" - мельтешение по краям обзора. Считается, что по нему можно что-то определить. Оставим это на их совести.

[b]Итог:[/b] сырое поделие симулятора хотьбы. Вся эта псевдофилософия абсолютно не работает когда пытаются выехать на паре хороших идей. Одного этого явно недостаточно для хорошей игры! Хватит! Пора уже заканчивать эру "стартапных" игр, когда на рынок выбрасывается явно недоделанный продукт с обещаниями улучшить его и закосом под элитарность и андеграундность (или, как это модно писать, инди). Хорошо, когда пробуют найти новые приёмы. Плохо, когда выдают оригинальность ради самой оригинальности. Культовые игры привлекают людей своей цельностью, некоей новой логикой и свежим взглядом на привычные вещи. В Цильн же я не вижу ничего кроме желания что-то эдакое сотворить без определённой цели. Такое впечатление, что разработчики решили заставить игроков самим придумать цель в игре и смысл, которого изначально там нет. Так что, игра тянет не более чем на бесплатную демку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071779662', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1436634315}
review: Cylne est un puzzle surréaliste (et je n'utilise jamais ce mot au hasard) intéressant et passionant. Reste que parfois les graphismes frisent le difficilement regardables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053508326', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1571489227}
review: this is not a game. this is one of those interactive pieces of art that you get to have sitting on your desktop to look at while contemplating the deeper meaning of things.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974002194', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1485722536}
review:
[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]Impresions[/u] : [/h1][/th][th]v. 0 -[/th][/tr][/table]Que faut-il savoir de Cylne ? (je le prononce inexpliquablement « quylne » depuis le début) [h1]C'est quoi ?[/h1] 
Cylne offre une expérience sensible à la première personne. En en ayant essayé beaucoup dans son crénau, je ne crois pas qu'il s'agisse d'un jeu de "puzzle" (il le revendique d'ailleurs assez peu dans sa déscription), jusqu'à présent j'ai du mal à comprendre ce que j'y fais au juste ! J'ai envie de lui coller le terme « n'importe quoi » mais pas dans un sens péjoratif ! Il propose une constance remarquable dans la décontrusction de ses niveaux et « l'inacessibilité » de ses logiques, c'est le point le plus interessant du jeu jusqu'ici.

[h1]Visuellement[/h1]Si je parlais d'expérience sensible, c'est le visuel qui règne d'abord sur les autres sens (logique). Là, ça pêche, sincérement, le titre offre souvent des panoramas puissant et fascinant, mais il offre tout aussi souvent des visuels fades ou pas travaillé du tout. La majorité des scènes supportent mal le mouvement.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=476429562 VS. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=476426906 Déplacez-vous et la magie chute à grande vitesse, les Shader ne suivent pas, l'éclairage devient moins intéressant, posez vos yeux au mauvais endroit et vous verrez la structure des textures se répéter en boucle, ça m'évoque un Mod, un bon Mod. Le ciel bouge avec vous et souvent vous pourrez voir la bordure très inélégante de la carte. 
Le titre le fait exprès j'imagine, il vous force la main pour vous replier sur votre imagination ou veut vous rediriger sur vos autres sens. 
La technique (Dx9) se veut rétro., elle me rappelle ce que l'on pouvait voir il y a longtemps dans les jeux. 

Le jeu est court, comme tout ceux de son genre, 6 chapitres, des interactions minimales, WSQD et la possibilité de sauter. Sur le plan des options c'est décévant. Il n'y en a pratiquement aucune. Résolution, vsync, sensibilité souris, choisir le chapitre à jouer et c'est à peu près tout. Côté résolution j'étais attéré lorsque j'ai vu que les résolutions max sont le FHD et son pendant 16:10 (1920x1200). Vraiment déçus. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=476433985 Cylne est intéressant pour un public averti ou très curieux, il fait un effort nottable sur le son et sensation, refusant de laisser le visuel raffler l'expérience. Si vous voulez une expérience plus accesible (et aussi visuellement exceptionnelle, je vous invite à expérimenter MIND : Path to Thalamus avant de revenir vers Cylne, un peu plus intransigeant). 
+ dans le meme genre : Naissancee, mirrormoon et sans doute [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/296550]Niko[/url] (à paraitre)
[quote][h1]N'hésitez pas à réagir, que ce soit pour une question ou pour signaler une erreur[/h1][/quote] [table][tr][th]- -[/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/smithfield]Smithfield[/url][/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/discussions/forum/12/617328967244490669/][h1]Ajoutez-moi, si…![/h1][/url][/th][th][url=http://steamcommunity.com/discussions/forum/12/617329150699182932/][h1]Critiques:Les règles[/h1][/url][/th][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198071604159', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1434742503}
review: Autism.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057943340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1489791521}
review:
Cylne is really a great game!

Though I'm a FPS gamer, I have to recognise that Cylne amazes me with its innovative and unique emotional and visual style, based on non-verbal visual riddles. It requires from the player an insight into the hidden meaning of places and items. This game symbolises an internal spiritual journey into the deeps of human psyche, alternating between closed dark scary places and wide open shining spaces, such are fears and joys of life.

I truly recommend Cylne for all lovers of marvelous and emotional games.
I believe such innovative game style should be encouraged, as an exciting alternative to mainstream FPS games, opening the way to deeper and more emotional journey games.
Let's encourage the author to develop further his game, and give him the recognition he deserves for such a challenge, he's leading the way to a new pathway of video gaming.

To the author: good luck!
To the players: enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1432042220}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Cylne
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2015
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Experimental; Surreal; Exploration; Puzzle; Existential 
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] B-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 3-7 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Novelty seekers; Aesthetes; Game atmosphere connoisseurs; Casual gamers
[/list]

[quote]I received an activation key of this game from a press kit for the purposes of writing a review.  This did not affect my opinion; I will only recommend games that I like. If I do not like a game, I will not recommend it. Period. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration][b]View my mission statement.[/b][/url][/quote]


[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]CyIne[/b] is a first-person exploration and puzzle game that has no regard for conformity and genre standards.  This “game” is not really a game, but more an exploration of existentialism and what is known as “the existential attitude.”

“The existential attitude” is a philosophical concept that describes an individual’s starting point in their existential journey; it is described as: “a sense of disorientation and confusion in the face of an apparently meaningless and absurd world.”  This concept provides the most accurate description of the feeling [b]CyIne[/b] will invoke in the player. 

There is no narrative whatsoever; there is only captivating visuals and emotional music.  Those aesthetics will keep you enthralled as you will move around the surreal gameworld in first-person, solving puzzles and desperately searching for any sense of meaning behind it all.

Fitting with the overall concept of the game, there is practically no direction given… only slightly in the form of feedback and cutscenes if you did something particularly wrong or right.  You will need to explore and experiment if there is to be any hope of progress.

There isn’t really much else about this game that can be detailed.  I would say [b]CyIne[/b] shares the most similarity to games like [i]Dear Esther[/i] and [i]Only If[/i]; but [b]CyIne[/b] is drastically more abstract and surreal, and truly sits in a league of its own.

I can see how some people who are more action-oriented and are perhaps less patient may find this game boring and will not enjoy it.  If that sounds like you, you may want to stay clear.  However, if you are someone who enjoys experimental games, and if you are someone who can appreciate the novelty of an exploration of existentialism through the medium of a video game: then you should check out [b]CyIne[/b].

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198071445530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1638227288}
review:
I really like this game. I kick back after a long day, open a random chapter, and my mind completely melts because I have no idea what's going on and don't really feel the need to know, either. There's a lot of emotion tied into the environment, and you really have to feel the game out for yourself to enjoy it.

One thing though, devs....am I supposed to get stuck in Chapter 4? I get up on this walkway, zoom through a wind tunnel, and the camera pans behind me ... then I get indefinitely stuck until I quit to the main menu. Pretty sure that's a bug.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991545801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1442746246}
review:
Imagine the sensation of exploring a surreal world that appears rational in a way that is simply beyond your understanding.  It's beautiful, filled with light and sound, and you seem to be solving puzzles of some sort -- or maybe you're just stumbling upon the laws of time and physics in this unfamiliar world.  It seems safe, this world doesn't seem to want to hurt you, so you keep exploring.  Maybe there's a point to what you're doing, or maybe not - does it really matter? Whatever it is, it's strangely fascinating - and at the same time calming.

The best compliment I can pay this game so far is that it seems to have captured in some sense the sensation of one's first visit to Burning Man - wandering the Playa at night taking in the surreal world around you, trying to make sense of it all.  If you've ever been, you know what I mean.

I love to see indie developers pushing the boundaries of gaming in this way, I think the "visual poem" metaphor very accurate.  Well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086542708', 'num_games_owned': 6444, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1425629920}
review:
I don't know what is happening in the game, I don't know why I solved the puzzles I solved or why I'm meant to care about solving them because the game so far has no explanation of any sort.

I am however, awash with colour & light; one of these days maybe I'll try and understand poetry so that maybe this game will make sense; until that time I think i'll just enjoy solving the so far numerous step-on-the-switches puzzles to trigger surreal waterfalls & then a cutscene that gives me even less of an idea of the point of all this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005915501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1425581990}
review:
So far from what I've played, I really enjoy the sounds and colors to this puzzle game. It's pretty trippy in places and very basic as controls go.  I wish there was a little bit more explination in the beginning as what does what in the game, but after getting the hang of it a little bit, it's pretty fun imo.
Player Two and myself each made a video of our first times playing if anyone wants to check it out on our YouTube channel.
https://www.youtube.com/user/HiddenLevelStart
